page.title: 15NEWPORT-STREET/PLACE NAMES
page.content: {HOLYROOD STREET-}The street leading to the Priory of {St.Cross}(rood means cross). {NODEHILL-}The southern part of Upper St.James St. The name is a contraction of{Noddies Hill}the place where Frenchmen,killed when they attacked Newport(probably in 1377) were buried. {A noddy }was a dead body. {STAPLERS ROAD-}The road down which the {Staple} or wool and sheep were brought to Newport market from the downs above Newport. {CHURCH LITTEN-}The burial ground belonging to St.Thomas's Church Newport. {PYLE STREET-}The road which led from Carisbrooke Castle to the most northern point at which the River Medina could be crossed by a{ford or {pyle. { }
